nodes.label: Dan's personal cognitive infrastructure
nodes.description: Long-term effort to build a second brain-like system that connects Codex, ChatGPT, agents, and knowledge graph structures for trading, research, and workflow meta-analysis.

nodes.label: Dan's Codex + ChatGPT meta-workflow (v1)
nodes.description: Current working pattern where Dan uses Codex and ChatGPT as primary thinking surfaces: Codex for live project work, specs, and pipeline design; ChatGPT for higher-level reflection, summaries, and second-brain architecture thinking. Knowledge currently lives mostly in conversations and ad-hoc notes, with an emerging intention to turn high-value threads into graph-structured artifacts.

capture_points: Codex conversations for active builds (specs, trading pipeline design, ML ideas)
ChatGPT threads for meta-analysis, second brain architecture, and workflow reflection
Occasional external docs/notes (e.g., Neovim config, trading research, YouTube/video transcripts)
storage_today: Local config/code repos (e.g., Neovim, trading infra)
Ad-hoc notes/docs when something feels important
intended_future_storage: Graph-structured knowledge base (principles, patterns, concepts, projects, tools)
Artifacts like this video summary encoded as nodes/edges
Project-scoped state snapshots for resumption and meta-analysis
ai_roles: Spec drafting and refinement partner (Codex + ChatGPT)
Future: graph-aware agent that can traverse principles/patterns/projects and propose changes
human_roles: Define intent and constraints for projects (trading, infra, second brain)
Curate which artifacts become first-class graph nodes
Decide when to standardize patterns vs leave things experimental
notable_characteristics: Session-based interactions with Codex tied to concrete work (coding, specs, trading pipeline design)
Higher-level, cross-project reflection done in separate meta threads with ChatGPT
Growing preference for principled, architecture-first thinking over tool-first setups
Explicit interest in resilience to tool churn and context-window limits

nodes.label: Codex (project + spec environment)

nodes.label: ChatGPT (meta-reflection + architecture)
